intro: Oreopanax aleurites, commonly known as the silver tree, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, silver-gray bark and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value and ability to tolerate various soil types make it a popular choice for horticulture.
